page.title: 20FARM CROPS
page.content: { { { }The crops grown at Ulley Hall farm are limited by the type of soil that is available.A very thin layer of soil lies over Gritstone.This means the farmer is unable to plough the land.Preparation for planting must be made by a disc harrow. All the crops are grown on a contract basis. This means that the crops are often sold before they are planted to local firms at a fixed price.Wheat,barley,peas and oil seed rape are grown on the farm.Much of the wheat is sold for pig food,the husks left after grinding are called sharps and sold as horse food.Inferior wheat is sold for cattle food.Peas are sold to Batchelors for freezing,drying or canning.Pasta wheat has been grown for the first time as an experiment.
